benchmark_details.name: BioKaLMA
benchmark_details.overview: BioKaLMA is a benchmark dataset facilitating Knowledge-aware Language Model Attribution (KaLMA), which evaluates the ability of language models to generate attributed answers using structured knowledge from knowledge graphs. It includes a unique task design focusing on citation generation from knowledge graphs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To propose a comprehensive evaluation benchmark for Knowledge-aware Language Model Attribution to improve the reliability of language models in generating accurate citations.

data.source: Constructed from biographical data using evolutionary question generation methods and a knowledge graph.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the alignment of generated citations with knowledge from the knowledge graph.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance of LLMs in generating accurate citations.
methodology.validation: Experimental validation through generated outputs and baseline comparisons.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset features a broad demographic variation of subjects, including individuals from 196 countries and 949 cities.
harm: Potential harmful input generation if misused.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collected from publicly available knowledge graphs.
